intro: Sebastiania weddelliana, commonly known as the Weddell's sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cup-shaped structures called cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sebastiania weddelliana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
